questiontext.text: A meteorologist who sampled 13 randomly selected thunderstorms found that the average speed at which they traveled across a certain state was 15.0 miles per hour. The standard deviation for the sample was 1.7 miles per hour. Find the lower limit of the 99% confidence interval for the mean. Round your answer to the nearest tenth.

A meteorologist who sampled 13 randomly selected thunderstorms found that the average speed at which they traveled across a certain state was 15.0 miles per hour. The standard deviation for the sample was 1.7 miles per hour. Find the upper limit of the 99% confidence interval for the mean. Round your answer to the nearest tenth.

A recent survey of 8 randomly selected social networking sites has a mean of 13.1 million visitors for a specific month. The sample standard deviation is 4.1 million. Find the lower limit of a 95% confidence interval for the true mean. Round your answer to the nearest tenth.

A recent survey of 8 randomly selected social networking sites has a mean of 13.1 million visitors for a specific month. The sample standard deviation is 4.1 million. Find the upper limit of a 95% confidence interval for the true mean. Round your answer to the nearest tenth.
Find \( t_{\alpha / 2} \) for a 99% confidence interval if \( n = 18 \).
Find \( t_{\alpha / 2} \) for a 95% confidence interval if \( n = 23 \).
Find \( t_{\alpha / 2} \) for a 98% confidence interval if \( n = 15 \).

The prices (in dollars) for a particular model of digital camera with 18.0 megapixel and a f/3.5-5.6 zoom lens are shown here for 10 randomly selected online retailers. Assume the price is normally distributed. Find the lower limit for the 95% confidence interval for the true mean price for this particular model. Round your answer to the nearest dollar; do not include the dollar sign.

The prices (in dollars) for a particular model of digital camera with 18.0 megapixel and a f/3.5-5.6 zoom lens are shown here for 10 randomly selected online retailers. Assume the price is normally distributed. Find the upper limit for the 95% confidence interval for the true mean price for this particular model. Round your answer to the nearest dollar; do not include the dollar sign.

A random sample of state gasoline taxes (in cents) is shown here for 12 states. Use the data to find the lower limit for a 90% confidence interval for the true population mean gasoline tax. Round your answer to the nearest tenth.

A random sample of state gasoline taxes (in cents) is shown here for 12 states. Use the data to find the upper limit for a 90% confidence interval for the true population mean gasoline tax. Round your answer to the nearest tenth.

For a group of 12 men subjected to a stress test situation, the average heart rate was 109 beats per minute. The sample standard deviation was 4. Find the lower limit of the 99% confidence interval of the population mean. Round your answer to the nearest whole number.

For a group of 12 men subjected to a stress test situation, the average heart rate was 109 beats per minute. The sample standard deviation was 4. Find the upper limit of the 99% confidence interval of the population mean. Round your answer to the nearest whole number.

In 2014, six percent of the cars sold had a manual transmission. A random sample of college students who owned cars revealed the following: out of 122 cars, 26 has manual transmissions. Find the lower limit of a 90% confidence interval for the proportion of college students who drive cars with manual transmissions.

In 2014, six percent of the cars sold had a manual transmission. A random sample of college students who owned cars revealed the following: out of 122 cars, 26 has manual transmissions. Find the upper limit of a 90% confidence interval for the proportion of college students who drive cars with manual transmissions.

A random sample of 205 college students was asked if they believed that places could be haunted, and 65 responded yes. Find the lower limit of a 99% confidence interval for the true proportion of college students who believe in the possibility of haunted places. Note: According to Time magazine, 37% of all Americans believe that places can be haunted.

A random sample of 205 college students was asked if they believed that places could be haunted, and 65 responded yes. Find the upper limit of a 99% confidence interval for the true proportion of college students who believe in the possibility of haunted places.

In a random sample of 200 people, 154 said that they watched educational television. Find the lower limit of a 90% confidence interval for the true proportion of people who watched educational television.

In a random sample of 200 people, 154 said that they watched educational television. Find the upper limit of a 90% confidence interval for the true proportion of people who watched educational television.

A random sample of 400 incoming college freshmen was asked their major preference, and 95 replied that they were considering business as a major. Find the lower limit of a 98% confidence interval for the true proportion of freshman business majors.

A random sample of 400 incoming college freshmen was asked their major preference, and 95 replied that they were considering business as a major. Find the upper limit of a 98% confidence interval for the true proportion of freshman business majors.

A recent study indicated that 29% of the 100 women over age 55 in the study were widows. How large a sample size must you take to be 90% confident that the estimate is within 0.05 of the true proportion of women over age 55 who are widows?

Nothing is known about the proportion of women over age 55 who are widows. How large a sample size must you take to be 90% confident that the estimate is within 0.05 of the true proportion of women over age 55 who are widows?

A federal report indicated that 27% of children ages 2 to 5 years had a good diet - an increase over previous years. How large a sample is needed to estimate the true proportion of children with good diets within 2% with 95% confidence?

A CBS News/New York Times poll found that 329 out of 763 randomly selected adults said they would travel to outer space in their lifetime, given the chance. Find the lower limit of a 92% confidence interval for the true proportion of adults who would travel to outer space.

A CBS News/New York Times poll found that 329 out of 763 randomly selected adults said they would travel to outer space in their lifetime, given the chance. Find the upper limit of a 92% confidence interval for the true proportion of adults who would travel to outer space.
